intro: Diascia burchellii, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, with hairy stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
